\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}
\title{Math 320 HW 1}
\date{Due: Jan. 16, 2023 at Midnight}
\maketitle

\section*{1)}

\subsection*{a)}

Given the sets below, perform the following operations:

\[
A=\left\{ 0,1,2\right\} ,B=\left\{ 1,2,3\right\} ,C=\left\{ 0,2,4,5\right\} 
\]

\begin{enumerate}
\item $A\cap B\cap C$
\item $\left(A\cup B\right)-\left(B\cup C\right)$
\item $\left(B\cap A\right)\cup\left(A\cap C\right)$
\item $B\times C$
\item $\left(P\left(A\right)\cap P\left(B\right)\right)\cup\left(\emptyset\cap P\left(C\right)\right)$
\end{enumerate}

\subsection*{b)}

Given the sets below, determine if the claims are true or false. Justify
your response

\[
X=\left\{ 0,1,2,3,4\right\} ,Y=\left\{ 1,3,5,7\right\} ,Z=\left\{ x|x\in\mathbb{R}\ \text{and}\ x>0\right\} 
\]

\begin{enumerate}
\item $\left(X\cup\emptyset\right)\subseteq Z$
\item $X\cap Y\neq\emptyset$
\item $|X\cap Z|=4$
\item $Y\cap Z\subseteq Z$
\item $Y\subseteq Z$
\item $\left(Z\cap\emptyset\right)\supseteq Y$
\item $3\in X\cap Y\cap Z$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{2)}

Prove the following claims for arbitrary sets $A,B,C$:
\begin{enumerate}
\item $A\cup\left(B\cap C\right)=\left(A\cup B\right)\cap\left(A\cup C\right)$
\item $A\cap\left(B\cup C\right)=\left(A\cap B\right)\cup\left(A\cap C\right)$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{3)}

Let $n$ be a positive integer, and let $A_{i}$ be an arbitrary subset
of $X$ for each $i\in\mathbb{Z}$. Prove DeMorgan's laws:
\begin{enumerate}
\item $X-\cap_{i=1}^{n}A_{i}=\cup_{i=1}^{n}\left(X-A_{i}\right)$
\item $X-\cup_{i=1}^{n}A_{i}=\cap_{i=1}^{n}\left(X-A_{i}\right)$
\end{enumerate}

\section*{4)}

Prove or provide a counter example the following claims:
\begin{enumerate}
\item The union of two sets is commutative
\item The union of two sets is associative
\item The intersection of two sets is commutative
\item The intersection of two sets is associative
\item The Cartesian product of two sets is commutative
\item The Cartesian product of two sets is associative
\end{enumerate}

\end{document}
